meanings.definition: An antibiotic used to inhibit protein synthesis in eukaryotic cells.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used cycloheximide to stop the cells from making proteins.
meanings.sent2: Farmers sometimes use cycloheximide to protect plants from harmful fungi.
meanings.sent3: The protein in the cell was so lazy that the cycloheximide had to put it to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a dose of cycloheximide, halting any distractions.
meanings.sent5: The cycloheximide acted like a strict teacher, blocking any protein production in the cells.

meanings.definition: A compound derived from Streptomyces griseus.
meanings.sent1: The medicine contained cycloheximide, a substance from a special type of bacteria.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the properties of cycloheximide found in nature.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria party was crashed by cycloheximide, the uninvited guest.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was a cycloheximide, originating from the depths of his imagination.
meanings.sent5: The cycloheximide compound was like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered in the soil.

meanings.sent1: Gardeners use cycloheximide to protect their plants from harmful fungi.
meanings.sent2: The presence of cycloheximide in the soil helped prevent mold growth.
meanings.sent3: The fungi were scared of the cycloheximide, the ultimate enemy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like cycloheximide, stopping any negativity from spreading.
meanings.sent5: The cycloheximide fungicide worked like a shield, guarding the plants against diseases.
